name: Temazepam
summary: Temazepam (Restoril) is a benzodiazepine used short-term for the treatment of insomnia.
description: Temazepam, marketed under the brand name Restoril, is an intermediate-acting benzodiazepine indicated for the short-term treatment of insomnia, particularly when difficulty in falling asleep or frequent nighttime awakenings cause distress or impaired functioning. It enhances the effect of the inhibitory neurotransmitter GABA at the GABA-A receptor, producing sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle-relaxant effects. Temazepam is typically prescribed for 7–10 days due to the risk of dependence, tolerance, and withdrawal. It is a Schedule IV controlled substance in the U.S.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to temazepam or other benzodiazepines

sections.text: Enhances the activity of GABA at the GABA-A receptor complex, increasing chloride ion influx into neurons, resulting in hyperpolarization and CNS depression with sedative-hypnotic effects.

adult.oral: 7.5–30 mg at bedtime; lowest effective dose should be used.

sections.text: Onset within 30 minutes; duration of hypnotic effect is approximately 6–8 hours.

serious: complex sleep behaviors such as sleep-driving

other: Risk of dependence, tolerance, and withdrawal with prolonged use
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants
Not recommended for use in pregnancy due to fetal harm risk

items.risk: Increased risk of sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death

sections.pregnancy: Contraindicated; potential teratogenic effects and neonatal withdrawal risk
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid use if breastfeeding
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; use lowest effective dose and monitor closely

sections.text: Gradually taper dose over weeks to reduce withdrawal symptoms and rebound insomnia.

items: Intended for short-term use only (7–10 days)
Benzodiazepine hypnotics are not first-line for chronic insomnia
Rebound insomnia may occur after discontinuation
